definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute

pinyin: ming2 yu4 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

definition: to rehabilitate/to regain one's good name

sentences.english: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻使这所学校名誉扫地。

sentences.english: We are delighted to be working with a company of such high standing.
sentences.chinese: 我们很荣幸能与一家名誉如此之高的雄司合作。

sentences.english: “Well, now I'm chairman emeritus,” Lauder says.
sentences.chinese: “哎，现在我是公司的名誉主席，”劳德说。

sentences.english: Elizabeth Wong, 37, said it was an insidious and underhanded attempt to smear her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 黄洁冰说，这种做法阴险卑鄙，是想破坏她的名誉。

sentences.english: His is currently the Honorary Chair of the Academic Affairs Committee of Beijing University of Chemical Technology.
sentences.chinese: 现任北京化工大学学术委员会名誉主任。

sentences.english: A banker can hardly afford a scandal, my dear.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，银行家也不会向不名誉的人提供信贷。

sentences.english: He was engaged as honorary president of Shanghai Aesthetic Education Society.
sentences.chinese: 聘为上海美育学会名誉会长。

sentences.english: We'll air conditioning unitcept change the terms of payment from L/C located at sight to D/P located at sight.
sentences.chinese: 我们答允将即期名誉证付款方式改为即期付款交单。

sentences.english: The People's Liberation Army should recognize its failings and restore its prestige through its own efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我们解放军要有自知之明，要靠自己恢复名誉。

sentences.english: Dr. Smith was not paid because he was the honorary chairman of the society.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯博士不获报酬，因为他是那个团体的名誉主席。

sentences.english: She is also an honorary faculty member at Fuyuan Cultural Arts Center in China.
sentences.chinese: 她同时也是中国富源文化艺术中心的名誉教员。

sentences.english: He was jealous for his friend's reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他深怕他朋友的名誉受损害。

sentences.english: Brevet is a form of military commission formerly used in US armies.
sentences.chinese: 名誉晋升是美军曾用的一种军衔。

sentences.english: A good name is dishonoured by unworthy conduct.
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的行为往往损害好的名誉。

sentences.english: Power is the great corrupter of politics, business– and marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治名誉由于他的非法婚姻而受到诋毁。

sentences.english: He tried to lie away her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他极力以谎言毁损她的名誉。

definition: to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to rehabilitate/to regain one's good name
right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
